001package imagingbook.lib.util;
002
003import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
004import java.io.PrintStream;
005
006/**
007 * Classes which require a complex {@code toString()} method should
008 * implement this interface, which requires the single method 
009 * {@link #printToStream(PrintStream)}, e.g.,
010 * <pre>
011 * public void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
012 *     strm.format("...", ...);
013 * }</pre>
014 * Note that this interface cannot override the default {@link Object#toString()} 
015 * method directly. If needed, this should be done in the implementing class by
016 * using the pre-defined {@link #printToString()} method:
017 * <pre>
018 * public String toString() {
019 *    return printToString();
020 * }</pre>
021 * @author WB
022 * @version 2021/09/17
023 */
024public interface PrintsToStream {
025        
026        /**
027         * To be implemented by concrete implementations.
028         * This method is supposed to write a description of this object
029         * to the given {@link PrintStream}.
030         * @param strm the output stream to print to
031         */
032        public void printToStream(PrintStream strm);
033        
034        /**
035         * Utility method to save some boilerplate code.
036         * Returns the description of this object produced
037         * by {@link #printToStream(PrintStream)}.
038         * @return the string representation of this object
039         */
040        public default String printToString() {
041                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
042                try (PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas)) {
043                        printToStream(strm);
044                }
045                return bas.toString();
046        }
047
048}
